author: Nadia Salemme
title: Super Bowl 2017: Lady Gaga headlines halftime show
text:
THE Super Bowl is back at the scene of it’s most controversial-ever halftime show — Janet Jackson’s ‘wardrobe malfunction’ more than a decade ago. 
Lady Gaga is headlining the halftime show at today’s 51st Super Bowl between the Patriots and Falcons, being held in Houston.
The Perfect Illusion singer’s performance is expected to include an anti-Donald Trump theme, as Gaga publicly supported former Democrat nominee Hillary Clinton during the US presidential election.
Singer Lady Gaga poses on the field at the Super Bowl. Picture: AFP Source: AFP 
Of course, Janet Jackson and Justin Timberlake’s Super Bowl performance of 2004 made headlines when Timberlake tore off part of Janet’s PVC corset to reveal her breast, with the nipple strategically covered with a silver star.
Gaga, however, is not planning to replicate the nipple slip.
“Everything’s going to be nice and tight for the game, so I wouldn’t worry about that,” she told reporters last week.
Lady Gaga says she has been planning her Super Bowl performance since she was four. Picture: AFP Source: AFP 
Gaga said her performance would include “hundreds of lit-up drones”.
“I’ve been planning this since I was 4, so I know exactly what I’m going to do,” she said, according to CBSS Sports .
“The thing is, is it’s such a big world stage in terms of how many people see it and it’s been done so many times.
“What can I do differently, how can I elevate certain little things here and there and also make it about the music?’”
Earlier reports suggested Gaga wanted to perform on the roof at NRG Stadium.
As well as the halftime show (oh, and the actual NFL match), the Super Bowl draws a mammoth global audience because of the star-studded ads, each costing at least $5 million to book .
